content: Hi @WG-polonius, time for the deferred hackathon. I wrote some notes about solving constraints on HRTBs that I'm prepared to present from. And we can talk about some of the stuff @lqd brought up if @nikomatsakis is running late.

lqd said:

I wasn't able to make much progress myself, but I'm still good for the 10th. I also wanted to hear more about these ideas (including the recent negation change, as I also incorrectly assumed ¬(a ⊆ b) implied b ⊂ awhen I read your implementation at first), and wanted to continue looking at your soufflé branch (hopefully I can do more of that by then) (but also would like to discuss whether you'd prefer we land that or that we'd look into DDlog), and also wanted to check what y'all thought about doing for .next
:coffee: :check:
do you want to present in a voice call ? :)
Yes, that was my idea. I hate wall of text typing. @nikomatsakis was just in the chat, so I'd prefer to do chime, but I'll start a jitsi just in case
Yay. Okay, I'm live at https://meet.jit.si/PoloniusHack20211210. We can switch to chime once Niko gets set up.
I'm always a little afraid that a naked stranger is going to join the jitsi chat.
VitalyR in the meeting is me, just want to learn about Polonius :)
@Dylan MacKenzie (ecstatic-morse) @nikomatsakis thanks you two that was great and super fun, as always :)
Hey @VitalyR! Sorry I missed your message this morning, and I muted you since I was hearing static from someone's mic .
Hopefully you learned something interesting. That part of the meeting was more theoretical than what we normally do.
Let me know if you have any questions.
